page.title: 11A LIFE IN THE DAY OF ANNA
page.content: IN THE LESSONS;SOMETIMES WE DRAW AND SOMETIMES WE WRITE.AFTER THAT COMES FRENCH:OCCASIONALLY WE HAVE VOCAB. TESTS,OR WE MIGHT BE READING OUR BONJOUR MAGAZINES.I'M OFTEN BORED WHEN MR. GUEST TALKS ABOUT 'ER' VERBS. BREAK FOLLOWS AND WE'RE OFF TO THE PORCH FOR MILK AND BISCUITS.IN THE SUMMER WE PRACTISE ROUNDERS AT BREAK IN THE WINTER NETBALL OR HOCKEY. THE WHISTLE REMINDS ME IT'S ENGLISH.SPELLING LISTS ARE TESTED ON SATURDAYS:THEN MRS. ASTRIDGE READS TO US.SCIENCE FOLLOWS-MANY EXPERIMENTS THAT ARE AWFULLY GOOD FUN.LUNCH FOLLOWS,AND SOMETIMES IT TASTES HORRIBLE!THE TIME GOES SO QUICKLY, THOUGH,THAT IT SEEMS LIKE TEN MINUTES LATER IT IS REST. AFTER READING OUR BOOKS WE COME TO GAMES.GAMES TIMES ARE GOOD FUN BECAUSE WE PLAY ROUNDERS OR DO ATHLETICS.
